TextView.android:text: In 2006, Tarana Burke began the Me Too movement to help spread awareness of sexual harassment and to bring attention to victims of these terrible acts, specifically focusing on women and women of color. The movementâ€™s goal is to put several survivors in front of the media, courts, and to have them lead protests in order to forge the solutions that would help decrease the cases of sexual harassment and bring global awareness to these issues.

Actresses like Alyssa Milano began to expand the movement once it started, communicating that they wanted people to understand the magnitude and prevalence of sexual harassment victims. As the Me Too movement gained more attention, it led several states to prohibit the use of confidentiality agreements in sexual harassment cases. With more recognition, a group of women in Hollywood started a charity and have raised over 24 million dollars since 2018-- this has led to over 3,900 women getting legal support for their cases.

The movement began to change the world after eighty women accused Harvey Weinstein of sexual harassment. Afterwards, an accusation of Supreme Court member Brett Kavanaugh sexually harassing Stanford professor Christine Ford led women to speak out about their experiences. Because of this, people began changing their views about the purity of people in power. Weinstein is one of many men in power who was fired due to sexual harassment allegations, and consequently, many women have felt more empowered to share their stories due to the punishment that these men receive. Globally, 90% of rape victims are female, and 82% of general sexual harassment victims are women as well, and after the movement sparked in the United States, the world began to realize that Americans are not the only people who have mistreated women.

MeToo has become prevalent in many other countries around the world, especially places that have had many cases where women have been mistreated. Countries such as France, Nigeria, Australia, India, and many more have started to speak out about their experiences of sexual harassment. In France, Roman Polanski, who has raped many underage girls, sparked a movement within the country. This caused the younger generation in France to be much stronger and they refused to silence the stories of women being sexually assaulted and catcalled, which was common in the streets of France. In Australia, because they are not protected by freedom of speech, women have had a harder time speaking out about their sexual harassment situations. But, a case with Geoffrey Rush gained momentum and allowed Australians to get rid of some old restriction laws. In Nigeria, women started a hashtag #Sex4Grades, where they were forced to have sexual relations with a professor or lecturer for a better grade. Thousands of women have joined together to fight these men and hopefully bring an end to the assault. With the built up anger of thousands of cases that were not filed or fought against, the MeToo movement has been one of the biggest revolutions in Indian history, with thousands of women sharing their traumatic experiences.
